title: Benktander type I distribution
summary: The Benktander type I distribution is one of two distributions introduced by Gunnar BenktanderÂ (1970) to model heavy-tailed losses commonly found in non-life/casualty actuarial science, using various forms of mean excess functions (Benktander & Segerdahl 1960). The distribution of the first type is "close" to the log-normal distribution (Kleiber & Kotz 2003).
